scenario: Joining DU art society and preparing for her first North Campus exhibition.

dialogue.speaker: Aisha
dialogue.text: Yaar, finally DU art society mein select ho gayi! So excited for the North Campus exhibition.

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Wah, Aisha! That's amazing news! Exhibition kab hai and what are you planning to showcase?

dialogue.speaker: Aisha
dialogue.text: It's next month. I'm thinking of doing a series on Delhi's street life, maybe some watercolors. Kya lagta hai?

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Sounds fantastic! Street life watercolors will definitely resonate with everyone. Need any help with supplies or anything?

dialogue.speaker: Aisha
dialogue.text: Thanks! Actually, I'm a bit short on good quality paper. Koi achha store pata hai kya around Kamla Nagar?

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Haan, there's 'Art Central' near Spark Mall. Thoda expensive hai, but the quality is top-notch. All the best, Aisha!

scenario: Troubleshooting CI-pipeline build error on Ubuntu server.

dialogue.speaker: Rohit
dialogue.text: Arre yaar, yeh CI pipeline phir se fail ho gaya! Ubuntu server pe build error aa raha hai.

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Oh no! Error message kya hai? Maybe I can help. Mumbai data centre wala server hai na?

dialogue.speaker: Rohit
dialogue.text: Haan, Mumbai wala hi. Error hai 'package dependencies unmet'. I think kuch apt update/upgrade ka issue hai.

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Try adding 'sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade -y' before the build step in your CI config. Dekho chalta hai kya.

dialogue.speaker: Rohit
dialogue.text: Okay, adding that now. Fingers crossed! Yeh open-source project mein itna tension hai, bhai.

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Tell me about it! But hey, at least you're contributing. Let me know if that fixes it, warna we'll dig deeper.

scenario: Explains beginner Ashtanga yoga routine in Chennai.

dialogue.speaker: Sneha
dialogue.text: Namaste! Aaj hum Ashtanga ka basic routine karenge. First, pranayama, okay? Deep breaths in and out.

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Okay, Sneha. Pranayama mein kya karna hai exactly?

dialogue.speaker: Sneha
dialogue.text: Ujjayi breathing! Inhale slowly, feel your chest expand. Exhale completely, contracting your abdomen. Try five rounds.

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Got it. Ujjayi breathing... then what?

dialogue.speaker: Sneha
dialogue.text: Next, Surya Namaskar A. Five rounds. Remember to synchronize your breath with each movement. Inhale up, exhale down.

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Surya Namaskar A... theek hai. I'll try my best to keep up!

scenario: Seeking authentic vada pav near IIT Bombay.

dialogue.speaker: Deepak
dialogue.text: Excuse me, bhaiya! IIT Bombay ke aas-paas sabse accha vada pav kahan milega? I'm craving some real Mumbai street food.

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Arre, IIT ke bahar toh bohot stalls hain. But for authentic taste, try Ashok Vada Pav near Kirti College. Thoda door hai, but worth it!

dialogue.speaker: Deepak
dialogue.text: Kirti College? Okay, got it. Is it easy to reach by auto or something? Aur koi option hai jo thoda nazdeek ho?

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Auto mil jayega easily. Nazdeek mein, there's a stall near Powai Lake, but Ashok's is legendary. Trust me, ek baar try kar lo.

dialogue.speaker: Deepak
dialogue.text: Powai Lake wala bhi theek hai? Just in case I'm feeling lazy. What makes Ashok's so special anyway?

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Powai wala is okay, chal jayega. But Ashok's pav is softer, chutney is spicier, and the vada is just...perfect. Ekdum Mumbai ka taste!

scenario: Negotiating saree wholesale rates in Panipat.

dialogue.speaker: Priya
dialogue.text: Namaste! Yeh jo Banarasi sarees hain, wholesale mein kya rate lagega? I want to stock them in my Delhi boutique.

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Namaste! Madamji, Banarasi toh premium hai. For bulk, ₹3500 per saree padega. Kitni chahiye aapko?

dialogue.speaker: Priya
dialogue.text: Thoda zyada lag raha hai. I was hoping for around ₹3000. I'm planning to take at least 20 pieces initially.

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Madam, 20 pieces mein toh mushkil hai. But since aap Delhi se hain, chalo ₹3300 final. Isse kam nahi ho payega.

dialogue.speaker: Priya
dialogue.text: Okay, ₹3300 is fine. But can you include some variety in designs and colors? I need a good mix for my customers.

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Bilkul! Variety toh humara specialty hai. Aap tension mat lijiye. I'll make sure you get the best collection. Deal pakki?

scenario: Debates Dhokra RPG strategies amidst Voice of India server lag.

dialogue.speaker: Arjun
dialogue.text: Yaar, this Voice of India lag is killing me! How are we supposed to coordinate the Dhokra raid?

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: I know, right? Maybe we should try a different server? Or just focus on buffing our characters first?

dialogue.speaker: Arjun
dialogue.text: Buffing is good, but we need a solid strategy for the Gada boss. I was thinking, I'll tank, you heal, and Rohan DPS?

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Hmm, Rohan's DPS is kinda low. Maybe he should focus on crowd control instead? And I can off-heal if needed.

dialogue.speaker: Arjun
dialogue.text: Okay, crowd control it is! But seriously, this lag is making it impossible to time our abilities. Koi jugaad karna padega.

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: True that! Let's try restarting our routers? Maybe that'll help a little. Otherwise, pray to the ping gods!

scenario: Planning a family trek to Lohagad Fort near Pune.

dialogue.speaker: Sunita
dialogue.text: Okay, toh Lohagad trek ka plan final? Weekend pe chalenge. Train tickets book karoon Pune tak?

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Haan, haan, final! Tickets book kar lo. Aur wahan se Lohagad kaise jayenge? Local transport milega?

dialogue.speaker: Sunita
dialogue.text: Haan, local buses aur jeeps milte hain Lonavala se. But I was thinking, ek local guide bhi hire kar lein? History bhi pata chalegi.

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Guide ka kya rate hoga? Budget bhi dekhna hai. Aur kitne time ka trek hai?

dialogue.speaker: Sunita
dialogue.text: Maine suna hai around ₹1000-₹1500 mein guide mil jaata hai. Trek toh 2-3 ghante ka hai, easy climb hai family ke liye.

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Perfect! Toh guide book kar lo aur main snacks pack karta hoon. Lohagad, here we come!

scenario: Brainstorms a Ganesh Chaturthi social media campaign for a Mumbai events startup.

dialogue.speaker: Vikram
dialogue.text: Okay team, Ganesh Chaturthi aa rahi hai! Social media pe kya dhamaka karein?

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Sir, last year toh 'Eco-friendly Ganpati' theme chala tha, this year kuch naya?

dialogue.speaker: Vikram
dialogue.text: Haan, eco-friendly is good, but let's add a Mumbai twist. Maybe 'Mumbai's Biggest Ganpati Mandal Hop'?

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Interesting! We can create a map and encourage people to share their experiences using a hashtag?

dialogue.speaker: Vikram
dialogue.text: Exactly! Aur contests rakhte hain, best Ganpati decoration, best bhajan performance... hashtag use karne pe.

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Perfect! I'll draft a proposal with the hashtag and contest rules. Let's aim for maximum engagement, sir!

scenario: Reviews TB case presentation for AIIMS grand rounds.

dialogue.speaker: Ananya
dialogue.text: Okay, so first slide mein patient ki demographics and chief complaints, right? Koi bhool toh nahi rahi main?

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Haan, demographics, age, gender, occupation. Aur presenting complaints toh definitely. Don't forget duration bhi.

dialogue.speaker: Ananya
dialogue.text: Right, duration bhi. Then history of present illness, pura chronological order mein? Ya kuch skip kar sakte hain?

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Chronological is best, makes it easier to follow. But focus on relevant details, ya. No need to overcomplicate things.

dialogue.speaker: Ananya
dialogue.text: Cool. Next, examination findings. Should I include everything, even if it's normal, or just the abnormal ones?

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Just the significant findings, Ananya. And remember to correlate them with your history. Good luck!

scenario: Practices beginner Hindi-English code-switching phrases with his students at a Bangalore tuition centre.

dialogue.speaker: Rahul
dialogue.text: Okay class, aaj hum karenge code-switching. Like, 'I'm going to the *bazaar*, do you want anything?'

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Sir, *bazaar* matlab kya hai?

dialogue.speaker: Rahul
dialogue.text: Good question! *Bazaar* means market. So, 'I'm going to the *bazaar*, *kuch chahiye*?' See? Mixing Hindi and English.

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Acha! So, like, 'I'm feeling *bhukha*, let's get some food?'

dialogue.speaker: Rahul
dialogue.text: Exactly! 'I'm feeling *bhukha*'. *Bhukha* is hungry. Or, 'This is *bahut acha*, I like it a lot!'

dialogue.speaker: Interlocutor
dialogue.text: Okay sir, I think I understand. *Kal* we will practice more, right? *Kal* matlab tomorrow?
